message.content: Euphorbia helioscopia is a species of flowering plant in the spurge family. This plant has a hairy stem and leaves that are arranged alternately. It has small yellow-green flowers that grow in clusters at the tips of the stem. The leaves are oval-shaped with serrated edges, and they excrete a milky sap when broken. It can grow up to 30 cm in height and prefers dry and sunny areas. This plant is used in some traditional medicines to treat a variety of ailments like warts, coughs, and throat infections. It can be found in temperate regions throughout Europe, Asia, and Africa.
